p: Light quality can change the composition of essential oils in medicinal plants (Amaki et al. 2011). In a study by Batista et al. ( 2016), different qualities of light caused a change in the pattern of essential oil in Lippia alba. These researchers showed changes in the number of monoterpenes such as eucalyptol and linalool in two L. alba chemotypes under LED and fluorescent lamps. Noguchi and Amaki ( 2016) and Nguyen and Saleh ( 2019) reported an increase in monoterpenes such as alpha-pinene, beta-pinene, limonene and carvone in mint plants under red LED light.
